reviews.sentence: Wonderful little hotel. Loved our weekend stay at the Bristol. I got a great rate on line. Nicely decorated lobby. Helpful friendly staff at the front desk who made us feel welcome. Room was very comfortable with lovely decorations and even view of the ocean from the large windows. Free Wi Fi here unlike other city hotels. Friendly bar in the lobby with great happy hour deals on drinks and appetizers. Reasonably priced parking at the hotel with in out privileges. The hotel is within walking distance to fun neighborhoods and great restaurants. I felt safe walking at night with my daughter. Also close access to highways that took us to other areas of the city. I would definitely recommend The Bristol.
nice hotel in good location. nice hotel in good location at a reasonable cost. disappointed no pool.

Business Trip for group. I had a group of staff stay at The Bristol Hotel it was a very nice clean hotel with a wonderful staff. We booked 7 rooms and received a great rate. The hotel restaurant was reasonable in price and very convenient for group breakfast. The internet needs to be improved. While I had no issues some of my staff did. We will stay here again when in San Diego.

Comfortable well priced and a good location. The Bristol Hotel bedrooms are great. Very comfortable wel equipped. great beds and clean. Service was also efficient and friendly. The hotel lobby does not reflect the quality of the hotel. Only one person on the desks trying to handle telephone calls and guest enquiries. The location being a couple of blocks from The Gas Lamp District was great. Very happy with the hotel and good value.

Good room great price. I chose this hotel because I had a conference in a hotel at the waterfront. I walked there in about 10 min and it was a nice but quiet part of town. The wifi was fast room was clean and quiet at night. everything I could ask for when traveling for work.

This hotel is ok. The good moderately priced hotel that is pet friendly. We brought our small pomchi with us and they had a small sign in the lobby saying his name. 13 overnight parking for hybrid owners so yay for being a Prius owner. Hotel room is small and clean. Nice decor etc. The bad the walls in the hotel room are super thin. I assume we had a small dog in the room next to us as well and it would not stop barking for 20 minutes straight. It sounded like the dog was in the room with us. I booked the hotel through Hotel Tonight and had called the hotel afterwards to tell them the reservation would be for one bed and with a pet. But when we arrived to our room it was a two bed room. I called the front desk and the gentleman on the phone told me that since I had booked on hotel tonight that they gave me what they had available. I had explained to him that I had called the hotel to tell them the details of the reservation but he told me again that we had booked through hotel tonight and that is why. The hotel eventually changed us to a one bed room but it was still an inconvenience especially since I called ahead to avoid this. The worst. The bed. I had a pretty terrible night of sleep on this uncomfortable bed. And to add insult to injury the windows of the room do not block out any noise whatsoever. There is construction going on on the street below during our stay and it started about 6 am in the morning. During the night you could hear every car and train passing by. I came here to relax but instead I am going to leave more cranky than before. Overall I do not think I will be staying here again.
Bristol a good combination of style comfort and. Had a comfortable stay. This is my second time in the hotel. Love the decor and the design. You get convenience and style at a great price.

Nice hotel in excellent location. The hotel was nice but there were too many misunderstandings with the personnel in charge. They advertised 460 breakfast on Expedia but it was not offered at the hotel. The parking was 26 day but they charged me an extra half day despite being there 23 hrs because they count their day starting at 3PM. I had two rooms reserved under my name one for two nights and the other for one night. The people at the front desk could never figure this out and kept my guests out of their room a couple of times because their names were not on the reservation. One of the rooms was no cleaned because we came back before 2 PM. Not too bad but I think they could have done better. The location and the rooms.

Nice hotel. Pros. convenient location a few blocks from GasLamp district with tons of cafes and restaurants reasonable price parking discount for hybrid car helpful staff very clean bathroom restaurant at premises free wi fi. Cons. heating did not work and we were lazy to ask to fix it.
I have stayed at less expensive hotels and they offered free breakfast free parking you offer neither one of the two.

Small rooms laughable fitness center but friendly staff. Came to San Diego as a birthday trip for my wife. Decided to book with The Bristol Hotel due to the overwhelmimg positive reviews i read online. It is true that valet parking is the only parking available which i was prepared for. What i was nt prepared for was the price 30 for overnight parking i was charged. When we checked in i signed a paper agreeing to pay 26 for parking but the following morning my bill was 34 for parking. The gentleman at the front desk explained that their parking prices had risen within the last few months. I asked to see the agreement i signed the day before and someone crossed out the original price and added the higher price AFTER i originally signed. Of course no one knew how this could have possibly happened. He offered to contact his manager to see what could be done but seeing as how that was at 4 am and we were checking out by 8 am i doubt anything would ve happened. Top that with an extremely small room and outdated bathroom. Tablet was a nice touch but did nt work after my initial check in. Fitness center treadmill elliptical and bike machine. For almost 200 for 1 night i expected more from a downtown hotel. My advice if you stay here snap a picture of the paperwork you sign so they do nt try to up the pricing after you walk away. It may have been just 6 for me but why take a chance. Also print new paperwork that reflects current pricing. DO NOT STAY HERE.
great stay. the bed was very comfortable and the free wifi was amazing. The staff is very friendlyparking just too expensive.

We loved the beds. They were easily the most comfy hotel beds. We did not like that there was no warning about how expensive parking was per night. It was not just a flat rate and that was extremely disappointing.

Good location nicely renovated rooms and friendly staff. Great staff newly renovated rooms are great with an awesome shower. Great bed to relax into. Walls are a little thin valet parking is a little pricey.

Unpleasantly Surprised. First a disclaimer I doubt my stay is typical and I was not going to say anything but I received an email from The Bristol asking for a review. Here goesStay was polite but somewhat ambivalent. The sink in my room was motion activated so there was no way to get hot water. Nobody at the front desk seemed to understand and the maintenance guy seemed to not care. I had to shave out of a mug with hot water from the tub. The thermostat was quirky and inconsistent. I would set it to 68 but wake up with it at 71 because of some weird glitch. There was constant banging and noise starting at 8 AM every day. Two of the days there was no water between 10 AM and 0330 PMThe TV was off to the side of the bed not in front of it like every other hotel room I have been in. Coffee only until 100 AM The location is nice you are near quite a bit. The bed was comfortable. So it was not all bad. But the identity does not fit meaning the price. you are better to pay a little more and get nicer or save money and stay somewhere less expensive.
Very Good. not too busy. very friendly. room coffee greatneded another chair in the room. Wine in the bar during happy hour horrible. parking charge expensive.

Nice stay but the room description was misleading upon booking. The bed was SO comfortable. I also liked how nice and big the TV was. Upon booking I reviewed all pictures of my room options and I had selected a Primo King which according to the website had a little couch coffee table and vanity. This was not the case once i got to my room. I walked in and it was a standard room with none of the above features that the website advertised. I called down to the front desk to let them know it was not what i had booked according to their website and they said it was a primo room and that the ones in the pictures are accessible rooms. I am NOT saying that the room or hotel stay was terrible however I paid extra for an upgraded room based on the pictures provided and it was not the room I received. Seems like false advertising to me. Point is if you want to ensure you get the room that you are looking at on the website i would suggest calling and getting verification before you press complete reservation. Also they did not do turn down service. We were gone all day and they came to the door at 530 pm asking if we wanted them to clean our room. Typically this is done during the day not once you are back in the room for the evening.

Nice hotel with a great location. I would recommend it to other people however I think the parking costs are outrageous. They charge 40 dollar for overnight parking while the ACE parking 5 min walk charges 15 dollar overnight.
